result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R Kutz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with prison sentence on files 21CF579 and 22CF27, but consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.
---------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
---------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Comply with any mental health treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs.Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
---------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in court in custody via video from Dodge correctional Institution. DDA Herrmann and ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter on for Motion Hearing to Re-open. Defendant is withdrawing plea. Court has read through Brief and Letter. Atty Pruden makes record in addition to brief and to have all matters heard at once. Record by DDA Sempf. 
Court has read through materials and was sentencing Judge and denies motion for reasons stated on the record. No follow up by State, Defense. 22CF509 to be set over for Initial 
Appearance internally. Judge Reddy case but Judge Johnson will keep. Court in recess at 1122 am.
States Brief in Response to Defendant's Motion to Withdraw Guilty Plea
Sentencing hearing from 8/31/2022
Letter to Judge Re Scheduling
Motion to Withdraw Guilty Plea
Temporary Commitment

Defendant in court in custody with attorney Larry Pruden. DDA Sempf appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is on for plea/sentencing for case 21CF579, 22CF27, 22CF97 & 22CF168. Defendant is entering guilty plea on all counts. Court conducts plea colloquy with defendant. Court gives warnings as to deportation, firearm possession and voter ineligibility. 
1013 am Sentencing argument by DDA Sempf
1026 am Sentencing argument by Atty Pruden
1030 am Court goes over sentencing factors and objectives and sentences defendant

SENTENCE
21CF579, 22CF27, 22CF97 & 22CF168 COUNT #1 of each case CONCURRENT but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence
Wisconsin State Prison - 6 years, bifurcated
Initial Confinement - 3 years
Extended Supervision - 3 years

Conditions of Extended Supervision 
Costs
No alcohol
No drugs or drug paraphernalia
Counseling as recommended
Comply with any mental health treatment

Defendant is eligible for both Challenge Incarceration Program And Substance Abuse Program
283 days credit

Remaining counts are for costs only
*Transcript filed 9/30/2022*
Sentencing Memorandum
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

TOTAL BOND TO COVER 22GF809, 22CF168, 22CF97, 22CF27, & 21CF579.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.    Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR AARON GLEASON-TERRY.  NO INTENTIONAL CONTACT WITH JACOB BIRDSLEY. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): C.I. OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL CONTACT AT JAIL. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH C.O.  "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew R Kutz in court, in custody by video. New total bond set. Future dates remain. Minutes filed.

Defendant Matthew R Kutz in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court .  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Matthew R Kutz. Court in session @ 1:28 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status on all files - 22CF168, 22CF97, 21CF579, and 22CF27. Record by Atty. Prudent that the parties cannot come to agreement as to sentence so he is asking for plea and free to argue sentencing date. Court sets as requested.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Matthew R Kutz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Larry R Pruden not in court. Called @ 3:19 pm. Appearances made. Atty. Pruden does not appear. Court sets on calendar for tomorrow for attorney to appear.
Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Matthew R Kutz appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA JJ Crawford.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Matthew R Kutz. Called @ 3:23 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on 9th status on 21CF579, 1st status on 22CF168, 5th status on 22CF27, and 3rd status on 22CF97. Record by Atty. Pruden that he has received a global offer, but wants to counter offer with the state and asks for one additional status for either plea or request for trial dates. Court grants request. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew R Kutz appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Matthew R Kutz. Called @ 3:15 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for arraignment on 22CF168 and status as to other files - 21CF579, 22CF27, 22CF97. Record by Atty. Pruden who waives reading and enters not guilty pleas as to all charges. Request for status on all matters about 60 days out. Court sets as requested. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew R Kutz appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Atty. Sempf.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Matthew R Kutz. Called @ 2:05 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for waiver of preliminary hearing on 22CF168 and status conferences on 21CF579, 22CF27, and 22CF97.Called @ 2:05 p.m. Appearances made. Court goes over waiver of preliminary hearing form with the defendant, who responds to Court's questions. Court finds wavier to be knowing, voluntary, intelligent, and binds the defendant over for trial. Record by Atty. Sempf as to time to file information. Court grants request and sets all matter over.
Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew R Kutz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Matthew R Kutz. Called @ 3:04 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for status conference on files 21CF579 and 22CF27; Arraignment on file 22CF97, and Initial Appearance on 22CF168. Record by Atty. Pruden that he was unaware of the new file. State provides copy of complaint. As to 22CF97, Atty. Pruden has gone over charges and penalties, and enters not guilty plea on defendant's behalf. Further record by Atty Pruden who asks that all matters be set over until next week so he can go over the new complaint with the defendant. Court grants request and sets all matters over. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew R Kutz appeared in court, Attorney Larry R Pruden appeared in court for Matthew R Kutz, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court by JJ Crawford. Called @ 3:04 p.m. Appearances made. Matter was set for arraignment on 22CF97, 1st status on 22CF27, and 4th status on 21CF579. Record by Atty. Crawford that Atty. Herrmann still does not have information ready and is still determining if he is going to add charges before he files it. Court adjourns one final time for the information to be filed. All matters set out for a couple of weeks.
Arraignment scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Arraignment on March 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew R Kutz appeared in court, Attorney Larry R Pruden appeared in court for Matthew R Kutz, Attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:48 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for further proceedings on 22CF97, arraignment on 22CF27, and status hearing on 21CF579. Record by Atty. Pruden as to 22CF97 - DE would like to enter plea but State was given 30 days to file information. Atty. Herrmann responds to Court's questions as to why they need 30 days they he made need to add additional charges.  Court orders that information be filed within two (2) weeks. Court addresses Atty. Pruden as to arraignment of file 22CF27. Record by Atty. Pruden who enters not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court sets all matters over for two weeks. Court in recess.
Arraignment scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Matthew R Kutz appeared in court, in custody by video, Attorney Larry R Pruden appeared in court for Matthew R Kutz. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. State may have more charges coming from this incident. Information will not be ready by 2/17. Minutes filed.
Further proceedings scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Larry Pruden
